intro: Hirculus moorcroftianus, commonly known as the Moorcroft's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hirculus moorcroftianus is considered a rare and endangered species.
